text: The 1876 United States presidential election in Georgia took place on November 7, 1876, as part of the wider United States presidential election. Voters chose 11 representatives, or electors, to the electoral college, who voted for president and vice president. ==Background== Reconstruction in Georgia ended in 1871. ==Vote== The Tilden/Hendricks ticket carried the state of Georgia on election day. ==Results== {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |- style="background- color:#E9E9E9" ! colspan="6" | United States presidential election in Georgia, 1876 Dave Leip’s U.S. Election Atlas; 1876 Presidential General Election Results – Georgia |-bgcolor="#EEEEEE" align="center" ! colspan="2" style="width: 15em" |Party ! style="width: 17em" |Candidate ! style="width: 5em" |Votes ! style="width: 7em" |Percentage ! style="width: 5em" |Electoral votes |- ! style="background-color:#3333FF; width: 3px" | | style="width: 130px" | Democratic | Samuel J. Tilden | align="right" | 130,157 | align="right" | 72.03% | align="right" | 11 |- ! style="background- color:#FF3333; width: 3px" | | style="width: 130px" | Republican | Rutherford B. Hayes | align="right" | 50,533 | align="right" | 27.97% | align="right" | 0 |- |} ==References== ==Further reading== * Hogan, Richard, “Resisting Redemption The Republican Vote in Georgia in 1876,” Social Science History, 35 (Summer 2011), 133–66. ==Notes== Georgia 1876 Category:1876 Georgia (U.S. state) elections
title: 1876 United States presidential election in Georgia
